usage: Woh shaanth baitha tha. (He was sitting quietly.)
Woh ek daana insaan hai. (He is a wise person.)
Woh abhi naadaan hai. (He is still naive.)
Yeh sab dhakoslaa hai. (This is all deception.)

definition: To have tried/experienced (used in the context of a home remedy)
usage: Maine yeh nuskha azmaya hai. (I have tried this remedy.)
Uski kaarkardegee achi hai. (His performance is good.)
Usne phurthee se kaam kiya. (He worked with agility.)
Woh bedaar ho gaya. (He woke up.)
Usne bahut aziyat uthai. (He suffered a lot of torment.)
Mujhe jamaiyyaan aa rahi hain. (I am yawning.)
Use ukaiyyan aa rahi thi. (He was gagging.)
Woh hamara aaqaa hai. (He is our master.)
Uska yeh armaan hai. (This is his desire.)
Usse apne faisle par pachtaana pada. (He had to regret his decision.)
Apni cheezon ki hifazat karo. (Protect your belongings.)
Yeh bahut nazuk cheez hai. (This is a very fragile thing.)

definition: Employment, means of earning a living
usage: Usse achha rozgaar mil gaya. (He found good employment.)
Kya tumhare paas koi suboot hai? (Do you have any proof?)
Yeh baat saabit ho gayi. (This matter has been proven.)
Us par chori ka ilzaam hai. (He is accused of theft.)
Woh achaanak aa gaya. (He came suddenly.)

definition: 1. Birthday (Janam ka din) 2. From time immemorial (Janam Janam ka saath)
usage: Aaj mera janam din hai. (Today is my birthday.) / Hamara janam janam ka saath hai. (We have been together since time immemorial.)
Maine apni arz pesh ki. (I presented my application.)
Mujhe tumse bahut umeed hai. (I have a lot of hope in you.)
Qaidiyon ko riha kar diya gaya. (The prisoners were released.)
Yeh meri taqdeer mein tha. (This was in my destiny.)
Uska mizaaj achha nahin hai. (His mood is not good.)
Yeh hamari purani rasm hai. (This is our old tradition.)
Usne ek khoobsurat afsaana likha. (He wrote a beautiful novel.)
Uska bolne ka andaaz nirala hai. (His speaking style is unique.)
Uski zulm ki intihaa nahin. (There is no limit to his cruelty.)
Apni had mein raho. (Stay within your limits.)
Pahadi ki dhalaan teekhi hai. (The slope of the hill is steep.)
Tumhe koi mughaalta hua hai. (You have had a misunderstanding.)

definition: Easygoing, someone who has their act together
usage: Woh ek suljava insaan hai. (He is an easygoing person.)
Usne purkhuloos tareeqe se baat ki. (He spoke sincerely.)

definition: Forgiveness (acting on the quality of forgiveness, unlike maafi which is the action)
usage: Usne meri galtiyon ko darguzar kiya. (He forgave my mistakes.)
Apne goshvaarein tayyar kar lo. (Prepare your detailed accounts.)

definition: Enough, fortunate, a blessing (implies something is good enough given the circumstances)
usage: Jo mila woh ghaneemat hai. (What I got is enough/a blessing.)
Mujhe mazeed waqt chahiye. (I need more time.)
Shuraafa ki sohbat ikhtiyar karo. (Keep company with gentlemen.)
Is mein koi qabahat nahin hai. (There is no problem in this.)
Koi muzaiqa nahin. (No objection/no problem.)
Usne use varghalaya. (He incited him.)

definition: Digestion (plural, though often used for singular sense)
usage: Achhe haazmein ke liye pani piyo. (Drink water for good digestion.)
Yeh phal turshaa hai. (This fruit is sour.)
Pani mein namak ghol do. (Dissolve salt in water.)
Unknown
Unknown
Maqbuza ilaqa. (Occupied territory.)
Mujhe tumse milne ka ishtiaq hai. (I am eager to meet you.)
Uski shaamat aa gayi. (His misfortune came.)
Uski raan mein dard hai. (He has pain in his thigh.)
Mujhe shahar ka naqsha do. (Give me the map of the city.)
Woh mazaar par gaya. (He went to the shrine.)

definition: Beastly, ferocious, savage (having the nature of a beast)
usage: Woh darinda sifat insaan hai. (He is a beastly person.)
Usne mujhe tasalli di. (He consoled me.)
Woh chamaar hai. (He is a cobbler.)
Uski zaat kya hai? (What is his caste?)
Ped ki chaun mein baitho. (Sit in the shade of the tree.)
Mujhe tumhare sahaare ki zarurat hai. (I need your support.)
Usne naukri ke liye darkhaast di. (He submitted an application for the job.)
Yeh zameen pathreeli hai. (This land is rocky.)
Taj Mahal sangemarmar ka bana hai. (The Taj Mahal is made of marble.)
Yeh sang-e-marmar hai. (This is marble.) / Hum sab sang chalen ge. (We will all go together.)
Usne kapde par kaarna kiya. (She embroidered on the cloth.)
Subah ki hawa mein taazgi hai. (There is freshness in the morning air.)
Unmein gazab ki shabaahat hai. (There is a striking resemblance between them.)
Baadal chatt gaye. (The clouds parted.)
Darwaaze ke talay. (Under the door.)
Bina kisi jhijhack ke baat karo. (Speak without any hesitation.)
Yeh uski himaakhat thi. (This was his stupidity.)
Woh ek ahmaq insaan hai. (He is a foolish person.)
Lohe par zang lag gaya. (Rust appeared on the iron.)
Unka saudaa pakka ho gaya. (Their deal was finalized.)
Usse sifarish se naukri mili. (He got the job through recommendation/nepotism.)
Woh nisbatan behtar hai. (He is relatively better.)
Uska qad lamba hai. (His height is tall.)
Taleem ka silsilaa jari hai. (The continuation of education is ongoing.)
Ek bahadur sipaahi. (A brave soldier.)
Bahaane mat banao. (Don't make excuses.)
Apni jaan nisaar kar di. (He sacrificed his life.)
Yeh ek purasraar mamla hai. (This is a mysterious matter.)

definition: A word used to describe a girl who's good at cooking and cleaning, capable
usage: Woh ek sughar ladki hai. (She is a capable girl.)

definition: Opposite of sughar; one who burns food and is bad at cleaning, unkempt
usage: Woh bahut puhar hai. (She is very unkempt.)
Apne khayalat ka izhaar karo. (Express your thoughts.)
Use zindaan mein dal diya gaya. (He was put in prison.)

definition: Relationship of some sort (mother-in-law of one's son/daughter, i.e., mother of son's wife or daughter's husband)
usage: Meri samdhan aa rahi hain. (My samdhan is coming.)
Mujhe is mein sahoolat hai. (I find ease in this.)

definition: To ignite (like issuing a controversial statement), a flourish (in writing), a trick
usage: Usne ek naya shosha chhora. (He released a new controversial statement.)
Woh bahut achha meizbaan hai. (He is a very good host.)
Yeh mamla mashkook hai. (This matter is suspicious.)

definition: From the Arabic وحش, an intense form of ghabraahat (fear, dread, loneliness)
usage: Jungle mein waishat mehsoos hui. (I felt dread in the jungle.)

definition: All at once, in one go, lump sum
usage: Usne paise yakmusht ada kiye. (He paid the money in a lump sum.)

definition: Allegedly, stated, reported (stuff that people are saying but isn’t confirmed yet)
usage: Mubayyanah tor par woh mujrim hai. (Allegedly, he is the culprit.)
Yeh tasveer naql hai. (This picture is a copy.)

definition: A place with water and vegetation (opposite of the desert, like a forest), palm tree
usage: Nakhlistan (oasis) mein pani milta hai. (Water is found in an oasis.)
Mujhe usse bahut humdardi hai. (I have a lot of sympathy for him.)
Unknown
Allah tumhe umar daraaz de. (May Allah grant you a long life.)
Yeh hamari mushtarshka jaydad hai. (This is our shared property.)
Mere taalu mein dard hai. (I have pain in the roof of my mouth.)

definition: Absolutely not (used for negative emphasis), never
usage: Main hargiz nahin jaunga. (I will absolutely not go.)

definition: When something becomes a bud, to burst, to erupt
usage: Kali phoot gayi. (The bud burst open.)
Ped ki thainee toot gayi. (The branch of the tree broke.)
Usne meri baat se inkaar kar diya. (He denied my statement.)
Unknown
Apne dastakhat karo. (Sign here.)
Uske paas bahut jaidaat hai. (He has a lot of property.)

definition: Broker, agent, middleman (can have negative connotations, e.g., pimp)
usage: Usne dalaal ke zariye makan khareeda. (He bought the house through a broker.)
Mujrim giraftaar ho gaya. (The culprit was arrested.)
Woh tanhaa rehta hai. (He lives alone.)
Woh dono alaidaa ho gaye. (They both separated.)
Usne sachchi gavaahi di. (He gave true testimony.)
Woh achaanak namudaar hua. (He suddenly appeared.)
Woh apni galti par pashtaa rahi hain. (They are regretting their mistake.)

definition: Without logic/sense; can mean inconvenient (betuke waqt) or substandard (betuke shairi)
usage: Yeh betuke waqt hai. (This is an inconvenient time.) / Uski shairi betuke hai. (His poetry is substandard.)
Yeh phal baxaata hai. (This fruit is sour.)
Hum dalaan mein baithe the. (We were sitting in the patio.)
Ghar ka bara sehen hai. (The house has a large courtyard.)
Uski hansi banaavti hai. (His laughter is artificial.)
Unki baaton mein tazaad hai. (There is a contradiction in his words.)

definition: Water pouch made of leather, waterskin
usage: Usne mashak se pani piya. (He drank water from the waterskin.)
Yeh sab vaahiyaat baatein hain. (These are all nonsense talks.)
Edison ne bulb ijaad kiya. (Edison invented the bulb.)
Unknown
Mujhe unke darshan ho gaye. (I got a glimpse of him.)

definition: As a witness (gavaah means witness, gavaahan is more like as a witness. 'Woh gavaahan paish hua')
usage: Woh adalat mein gavaahan paish hua. (He appeared in court as a witness.)
Chaukanna raho. (Stay alert.)
Meri guzarish qubool karen. (Please accept my humble request.)
Usne sifarish ki. (He made a recommendation/forceful request.)
Woh ek achha gulkaar hai. (He is a good singer.)

definition: To handle, like bardaash (to endure, to maintain a relationship)
usage: Usne apni dosti khoob nabhaai. (He maintained his friendship well.)
Unhone saazish ki. (They conspired.)

definition: To show, in the context of to exhibit/show off, exhibition
usage: Uski numaish dekho. (Look at his show-off.)
Tumhara maqsad kya hai? (What is your purpose?)
Mera iraada achha hai. (My intention is good.)

definition: The best part of something, masterpieces (especially of written work)
usage: Yeh uske adab ke shahpaarein hain. (These are the masterpieces of his literature.)
Uska bada carrubaar hai. (He has a big business.)
Main uski baaton se mutaasir hua. (I was impressed by his words.)
Is kitaab par tabsira karo. (Comment on this book.)
Mujrim jail se faraar ho gaya. (The culprit escaped from jail.)
Yeh rishta paidaar hai. (This relationship is long-lasting.)
Ammi ne kheer banayi. (Mom made kheer.)

definition: To exchange something (negative sense, like grease the palms or bribe), collusion
usage: Unhone aapas mein mukmukaa kar liya. (They colluded with each other.)
Toofan zada ilaqe. (Storm-affected areas.)
Zindagi ka lutf uthao. (Enjoy life.)
Woh lutf andoz ho raha hai. (He is enjoying himself.)
Mukhtalif moaashiray. (Different societies.)

definition: To take heed of a lesson, maybe from someone else’s misfortune (used with Haasil, only for learning from misdeeds)
usage: Uski misaal se ibrat hasil karo. (Take a lesson from his example.)

definition: Benefits, interests (plural, used in politics, not casual conversations)
usage: Apne mafaadaat ka tahaffuz karo. (Protect your interests.)
Insani pinjar. (Human skeleton.)
Makaan ka dhanchaa. (The framework of the house.)
Woh hamara numainda hai. (He is our representative.)
Meri cycle mein panchar ho gaya. (My bicycle got a puncture.)
Usne tanz kiya. (He taunted.)

definition: Hollow boil, blisters (like on a human)
usage: Uske haath par bhapolay nikal aaye. (Blisters appeared on his hand.)
Ghore ko lagaam do. (Put the reins on the horse.)
Mujhe panaa chahiye. (I need refuge.)

definition: Fear, apprehension, 'I've got a bad feeling about this'/unease
usage: Mujhe khadshah hai. (I have a bad feeling.)
Koi andeyshah nahin hai. (There is no apprehension.)
Bache pehldooj khel rahe hain. (Children are playing hopscotch.)

definition: Unlikely event, impossible event (Anhoni is like not possible, (namumkin) but for not physical things)
usage: Yeh ek anhoni ghatna hai. (This is an impossible event.)
Yeh ek anokhi baat hai. (This is a unique thing.)
Woh abhi anardhi hai. (He is still an amateur.)
Usne gustakhana andaaz mein baat ki. (He spoke in a disrespectful manner.)

definition: A rip (like in clothing) usually for a specific reason, a fold, a corner
usage: Uske kapde mein khoncha hai. (There is a rip in his clothes.)

definition: Threshold (sometimes used to describe the little ridge beneath the door to a house)
usage: Ghar ki dehleez. (The threshold of the house.)

definition: To overcome, or to cross (a house's dehleez)
usage: Darya paar kar gaya. (He crossed the river.) / Mushkilaat paar karo. (Overcome difficulties.)
Sehatmand tan. (Healthy body.)
Woh aasuda zindagi guzar raha hai. (He is leading a prosperous life.)
Usne khazaana dhoond liya. (He found the treasure.)

definition: Journey (in the sense of a caravan/procession), negligence (less common usage)
usage: Qaafilat rawana ho gayi. (The caravan departed.)

definition: Garden, aka baagh (no difference in usage)
usage: Phoolon se bhara chaman. (A garden full of flowers.)
Hamari kehkashaan. (Our galaxy.)
Unknown

definition: Something small, a joke, an anecdote
usage: Usne ek chutkalaa sunaya. (He told a joke.)

definition: Stubborn, impudent (sharaarti - mischievous, someone who does something despite you telling them not to)
usage: Woh bahut dheet hai. (He is very stubborn.)

definition: Settlement (especially after a long argument), resolution (faisla)
usage: Jhagre ka tasfiyah ho gaya. (The dispute was settled.)
Apni haazirii lagao. (Mark your attendance.)
Uski aarzuu poori ho gayi. (His desire was fulfilled.)

definition: Cluster, crowd ('yeh kyaa jhumghataa lagaaya hua hain' - what you say when you see a big group of people)
usage: Wahan logon ka jhumghattaa tha. (There was a crowd of people there.)

definition: Unexpected but in a bad way, sudden, unforeseen
usage: Naa gahaani aafat aa gayi. (An unforeseen calamity befell.)

definition: If it gets dirty no one would notice? (Used for describing a dark sofa)
usage: Yeh mehlkhora rang hai. (This is a dirt-concealing color.)
Qoum ka paasbanh. (Guardian of the nation.)
Woh apne aziz ki maut par soge mana rahe hain. (They are mourning the death of their dear one.)

definition: To try to compromise/make things work between different words/people, to maintain
usage: Rishta nibhaana mushkil hota hai. (Maintaining a relationship is difficult.)

definition: Reluctance, hesitation (for speaking, it’s used kind of like holding your tongue), anxiety
usage: Usse baat karne mein taraddud ho raha tha. (He was hesitant to speak.)

definition: Happy (can also say Peshaawari, referring to something from Peshawar)
usage: Woh aaj bahut pishori hai. (He is very happy today.)
Khabar sun kar dil baghbaagh ho gaya. (My heart became delighted upon hearing the news.)
Hum saahil e samandar par gaye. (We went to the beach.)
Woh abhi kunwaara hai. (He is still a bachelor.)
Uska tanziyah andaaz. (His sarcastic manner.)
Meri darkhwaas manzoor kar li. (My request was accepted.)
Ek jhalak dikhai di. (A glimpse was seen.)

definition: Hindi word, used in dance (refers to the sound of anklets or bells in dance)
usage: Uske payal ki jhanak. (The jingle of her anklets.)
Woh bade saudaagraan hain. (They are big merchants.)
Aaj bahut dhund hai. (It's very foggy today.)
Yeh cheez phokat mein mil gayi. (This thing was obtained for free.)

definition: Covering, spread over (e.g., dhuhd chaaiyi vi hai - fog is spread)
usage: Puri fiza par udasi chaayii hui hai. (Sadness has spread over the entire atmosphere.)

definition: Sort of like a title, or a nickname, for poets (pen name)
usage: Ghalib ka takhallus tha. (Ghalib was his pen name.)
Woh ek saaduu hai. (He is a holy man.)
Usmein bahut tavaanai hai. (He has a lot of energy.)
Mujhe yeh nazm azbar hai. (I know this poem by heart.)

definition: To spread (in an abstract sense, e.g., spread joy), granted
usage: Khushiyan bakhshi. (He granted happiness.)
Ufaq par suraj doob raha hai. (The sun is setting on the horizon.)

definition: Behind (like behind a tree, or behind a door), cover, shelter
usage: Woh darakht ki oat mein chhip gaya. (He hid behind the tree.)

definition: Solution, remedy (fikr ki daryaaq - solution to worry), antidote
usage: Har masle ka daryaaq hota hai. (Every problem has a solution.)

definition: Sophistication, cleanliness, elegance (nafees - someone who’s picky about cleanliness)
usage: Uske kaam mein nifaasat hai. (There is sophistication in his work.)
Bhoojo to jaanein. (Guess if you dare to know.)
Woh duniya se beniyaaz hai. (He is carefree about the world.)
Yeh ek ghambhir masla hai. (This is a serious problem.)
Yeh khaalis doodh hai. (This is pure milk.)
Zameen par khaak udi. (Dust rose from the ground.)

definition: Harmful (like Nukhsaande, but maybe in different contexts)
usage: Yeh sehat ke liye muzir hai. (This is harmful for health.)
Woh apne maa baap ki aiklauthee beti hai. (She is the only daughter of her parents.)
Woh apne maa baap ka aiklauthaa beta hai. (He is the only son of his parents.)
Mujhe ilm ki tashnagi hai. (I have a thirst for knowledge.)

definition: Friendship, companionship (like dosti), company (like good company), closeness
usage: Uski rifaaqat mein mujhe khushi milti hai. (I find happiness in his company.)

definition: Atmosphere, where you have no restrictions/bounds, open space
usage: Subah ki fizaa bahut achhi hai. (The morning atmosphere is very pleasant.)

definition: Flight, to fly/be able to fly
usage: Parinde ki parwaaz. (The flight of the bird.)
Yeh naamaaqool baat hai. (This is a foolish thing to say.)
Woh bank ka kharaanchi hai. (He is the treasurer of the bank.)

definition: Generous, opposite of kanjuus (from Sakhaavat, generosity)
usage: Woh ek sakhee insaan hai. (He is a generous person.)

definition: Sad (like udaas, but implies a deeper, more profound sadness, not used interchangeably with udaas which is less sad)
usage: Woh aaj bahut afsurda hai. (He is very sad today.)
Uski taghaaful ki wajah se nuksaan hua. (Loss occurred due to his negligence.)
Apni ghaflat ki saza mili. (He got punished for his carelessness.)

definition: Public image, reputation (e.g., Saaq barhqaraar rakhna - to maintain one's reputation)
usage: Usne apni saakht kharab kar li. (He ruined his reputation.)

definition: To beautify, to adorn (barna savarna - getting super dressed up)
usage: Usne apne baal savare. (She groomed her hair.)
Yeh zameen sarkhaiz hai. (This land is fertile.)
Woh ek nausarbaaz hai. (He is a con artist.)
Woh apne maa baap ka laadla hai. (He is his parents' spoiled child.)
Woh usse milne ko beqaraar hai. (He is restless to meet her.)
Dosti barqaraar rakho. (Maintain the friendship.)
Unknown

definition: They observed you and selected you to be a target? (Used in the context of people deciding who to rob?), to recognize, to understand
usage: Choron ne usey taaR liya. (The thieves spotted him as a target.)
Yeh jagah sunsaan hai. (This place is deserted.)
Uska naam amar ho gaya. (His name became immortal.)
Jo bhi mayassar hai. (Whatever is available.)
Mujhe tumse aas hai. (I have hope in you.)
Woh musalsal kaam kar raha hai. (He is working continuously.)

definition: Skill, art, talent (someone’s really good at something, like cooking 20 pounds of meat without burning it)
usage: Usmein bahut hunur hai. (He has a lot of skill.)
Woh ek mumtaaj shakhsiyat hai. (He is a distinguished personality.)
Mujhe tumse koi gilaa nahin. (I have no complaint against you.)
Woh mera shaagird hai. (He is my student.)
Mujhe is mein khasaaraa hua. (I incurred a loss in this.)

definition: Respect, value (e.g., baron ka qadr karna - to respect elders)
usage: Apne ustad ki qadr karo. (Respect your teacher.)

definition: Deceitful (can also mean eloquent/flowery speech, or layered/coiled)
usage: Uski baatein lacchaydaar hain. (His words are deceitful/flowery.)

definition: Appetite, but also dosage (like of medicine), food, diet
usage: Dawa ki khuraak. (Dosage of medicine.)
Uski soch pukhtaa hai. (His thinking is mature.)
Taarameela ka tail sehat ke liye achha hai. (Arugula oil is good for health.)
Usne apne dost se ghaddari ki. (He betrayed his friend.)
Mujhe chiku pasand hai. (I like sapodilla.)
Garmiyon mein falsa bahut pasand hai. (I like falsa very much in summers.)

definition: Daily labor (mazdoor is the person, mazdoori is the work, like manual labor), wages
usage: Woh mazdoori karta hai. (He does manual labor.)

definition: Unknown (Possibly 'makrooh', meaning detestable/abominable, or 'makhdoom', meaning master/served)
usage: Unknown
Afyoun ek nasha hai. (Opium is an intoxicant.)

definition: Avoiding a food for health purposes, abstinence
usage: Doctor ne use parhaiz karne ko kaha. (The doctor told him to abstain from certain foods.)
Logon ne ihtijaaj kiya. (People protested.)

definition: Having dignity, full of pride, dignified
usage: Woh ek purwaqar shakhsiyat hai. (He is a dignified personality.)
Apna waqaar qaim rakho. (Maintain your dignity.)
Mujhe tum par i'tibaar hai. (I trust you.)
Yeh ek sageen masla hai. (This is a serious problem.)
Use kitabein padhne ka shaghaf hai. (He has a passion for reading books.)
Use bahaduri ka tamgha mila. (He received a medal for bravery.)
Yeh kaam bahut dushwaar hai. (This task is very difficult.)
Usne sach daryaaft kiya. (He discovered the truth.)
Unknown
Shahar mein fasaad ho gaya. (There was a riot in the city.)
Woh ek naaqadar insaan hai. (He is an ungrateful person.)
Sutlii se bandh do. (Tie it with a string.)

definition: Companion, friend (the one who you are close to? Used in very limited circumstances)
usage: Woh mera rafeeq-e-safar hai. (He is my travel companion.)
Gareeb ka chappar. (The poor man's shelter.)

definition: To issue, to force a decision (faislaa saadir karna), to emanate (used with faislaa, hukum denaa)
usage: Hukm saadir kiya gaya. (The order was issued.)

definition: To impose, to force something upon someone (slang)
usage: Mujh par apni ray mat thopo. (Don't impose your opinion on me.)
Woh qaabil-e-parastish hasti hai. (He is a worshipable figure.)

definition: Souls, individuals (from Nafs, plural, all the people)
usage: Hazaron nufoos. (Thousands of souls/people.)
Bahut nafees kaam hai. (It's a very fine piece of work.)
Shafaq ka khoobsurat manzar. (The beautiful scene of twilight.)
Uska sukhan bahut meetha hai. (His speech is very sweet.)
Aftaab chamak raha hai. (The sun is shining.)
Mahtaab ki roshni. (The moonlight.)
Suraj ki shuaon. (Rays of the sun.)
Unhone lambi gufto shaneed ki. (They had a long conversation.)

definition: Pangs in the heart (like pangs of sadness), to feel compassion/pity
usage: Uska dil ghareeb par paseej gaya. (His heart felt pity for the poor.)
Pet ki aantein. (Intestines of the stomach.)
Uska zariya e maash kya hai? (What is his source of income?)

definition: Really thin metal rods (like bike spokes), needles, matchstick
usage: Machis ki teeli. (Matchstick.)

definition: A person with Hunar, skilled, talented
usage: Woh ek hunarmand fankar hai. (He is a skilled artist.)

definition: To grow (plants, hair, etc.), to sprout
usage: Paudhe ug rahe hain. (Plants are growing.)

definition: A pledge, a vow (like 'if you do X, God, I will do Y'), prayer, gratitude
usage: Usne mannat maangi. (He made a vow.)
Mujhe is mein nafaa hua. (I gained profit in this.)

definition: Consultation, advice (mashfara - seems to be a phonetic interpretation)
usage: Mujhe tumhara math chahiye. (I need your advice.)
Wahan pani ki afraat hai. (There is an abundance of water there.)

definition: Clear (mostly for some idea being clear), distinct
usage: Uski baat waazay hai. (His point is clear.)

definition: Occupation, pastime, a funny story or anecdote
usage: Yeh mera shughl hai. (This is my pastime.)
Is imarat ki bunyaad mazboot hai. (The foundation of this building is strong.)

definition: Extended family, broader than khaandaan, community
usage: Hamari braadhree. (Our community.)
Badshah ki dukhtar. (The king's daughter.)

definition: Blessed by Allah (heard in the context of naming kids), something blessed or hallowed
usage: Unknown

definition: Show off, rogue, rowdy (can be negative)
usage: Woh bahut shodaa hai. (He is very showy/rowdy.)

definition: To collect on your loans, demand, requirement
usage: Qarz ka taqaazaa kiya. (He demanded the loan back.)
Mujhe koi shubaa nahin. (I have no doubt.)
Mujhe bahut musarrat hui. (I felt great joy.)
Unki rai mein mutaabqat hai. (There is compatibility in their opinions.)

definition: To keep/preserve something carefully, to save up
usage: Yeh cheez sainth ke rakhni hai. (This thing needs to be kept carefully.)
Yeh kamra kushaada hai. (This room is spacious.)
